review: I use this all the time. It's really convenient to be able to throw Netflix or YouTube videos from my phone to my tv instantly without having to load up either the Xbox or the Wii.My only caveat with it is that you are very limited as to what you can cast to the tv. As of this writing, you can only do Netflix, YouTube, and Google Play. I've heard they will be expanding the roster of potential casting locations, but until then, I'll have to settle with those three.

review: We bought the Chromecast specifically to stream from Chrome onto our smart TV. Setup was pretty easy... until we realized that you cannot stream from Chrome on an iOS device (iPad, iPhone). You can only use the existing apps -- Netflix and Youtube. That is NOT well described anywhere on the Google Chromecast site. They just say that it's "compatible" with iOS devices. So, we tried streaming from our laptop using Chrome. It "worked" but just barely, if you could even say that. The lag was so terrible that the audio/video never matched up and the video essentially froze. This device sounded too good to be true... and it was. I am returning this right away.
